def.dt: :an interior or internal part or place :the part within
:inward nature, thoughts, or feeling
:viscera entrails usually used in plural
:an inner side or surface
:a position of power, trust, or familiarity only someone on the inside could have told
:confidential information has the inside on what happened at the convention
:the area nearest a specified or implied point of reference: as
:the side of home plate nearest the batter
:the middle portion of a playing area
:the area near or underneath the basket in basketball
:on the inner side
:in or into the interior stayed inside during the storm
:to or on the inside
:in prison
:of, relating to, or being on or near the inside an inside pitch
:relating or known to a select group inside information
:behind-the-scenes
:in or into or as if in or into the interior of waited inside the church
:on the inner side of just inside the door
:within inside an hour
:address 5c
:inside
:in such a manner that the inner surface becomes the outer turned the shirt inside out
:to a thorough degree knows the subject inside out
:in or into a state of disarray often involving drastic reorganization turned the business inside out
:an advantageous competitive position the owner's son has the inside track for the job
protected shipping route from Puget Sound, Washington, to Skagway, Alaska, following channels between mainland & coastal islands
